description: From Old French description, from Latin dēscrīptiō, noun of action of dēscrībō (“I describe”).

entries.meaning: A sketch or account of anything in words; a portraiture or representation in language; an enumeration of the essential qualities of a thing or species.
examples: give a verbal description of the events

entries.meaning: The act of describing; a delineation by marks or signs.
A set of characteristics by which someone or something can be recognized.
examples: The zoo had no lions, tigers, or cats of any description.

entries.meaning: (taxonomy) A scientific documentation of a taxon for the purpose of introducing it to science.
examples: The type description of the fungus was written by a botanist.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) The act or practice of recording and describing actual language usage in a given speech community, as opposed to prescription, i.e. laying down norms of language usage.
